Honolulu.Spalding House:
Spalding House, also known as the Cooke-Spalding House and called Nuumealani (heavenly terrace) by Mrs. Cooke, together with its gardens constitute a 3½ acre campus of the Honolulu Museum of Art located in Makiki Heights, on the island of O'ahu.
Spalding House was built as a residence in 1925 by Anna Rice Cooke, widow of Charles Montague Cooke.
